comment.lg.version: Subdivision of an article which does not have a distinctive sign (number, letter or dash).

source.description: sole element or a non-independent element of an article (JPG 15.4, table) or exceptionally an element of an annex
distinct part of an act that generally contains rules or technical data which, for practical reasons, do not appear in the enacting terms, and frequently take the form of a list or table
An appendix is a distinct supplementary part of an act which generally contains explanatory or statistical information, and which frequently take the form of a list or table.

comment.lg.version: Distinguishable by the standardised title, which consists of the expression ‘Article’ followed by a sequential number or preceded by ‘sole’.

source.description: basic component of the enacting terms of a legal act

comment.lg.version: In the hierarchy, citations are elements of the preamble.

source.description: legal basis for an act or a preparatory act and in the case of a legislative act also the procedure followed and the transmission of a draft legislative act to national parliaments

comment.lg.version: Chapters have distinctive signs of type Arab numerals 1, 2, 3 etc. or uppercase Roman numbers I, II, III etc.
In the hierarchy of subdivisions, chapter is between title and section.

source.description: higher subdivision within a legal act used to introduce a group of articles in the enacting terms

comment.lg.version: As indents have no figure nor other sign of identification, ordinal numbers written by letters are used to refer to them: first indent, second indent, third indent etc.

source.description: element of an enumeration preceded by a dash
The PAR element is used to mark up a subdivision of an article numbered using Arab numerals within a European legal text. It is made up of at least one alinea or quoted text.

comment.lg.version: Indicates either each element of an enumeration inside a paragraph, a subparagraph or a point (this enumeration being generally preceded by an introductory phrase); or is possibly used independently as a basic unit, e.g. in annexes or preparatory documents.

source.description: structure component of a legal article that has a distinctive sign of the type Arabic numbers: (1), (2), (3) etc.
element in the preamble that sets out the reasoning for the chief provisions of the enacting terms
The RULE element is used in some acts, such as in Commission Regulation (EC) No 2868/95 of 13 December 1995.
L'élément RÈGLE est utilisé dans certains actes, comme dans le règlement (CE) n° 2868/95 de la Commission du 13 décembre 1995.
A clause is a distinct provision at the end of an agreement, a treaty or another act.

comment.lg.version: Sections have distinctive signs of type Arab numerals 1, 2, 3 etc.

source.description: lowest of the four higher subdivisions of an act (others are parts, titles and chapters) used to introduce a group of articles in the enacting terms
part of an act positioned after the title of the act that includes the citations, the recitals and the solemn forms preceding the enacting terms

comment.lg.version: The complete title of an act comprises type of act, number of act, name of the author of the act, date of adoption and subject matter. In the case of subdivisions, the title contains the subject matter.
The Common Vocabulary (CoV) definition ‘The title of the document comprises all the information in the heading of the document which serves to identify it’ is referring to the same.

source.description: designation of an act or the designation of a subdivision (e.g. article, chapter, part) of an act

comment.lg.version: In the hierarchy of subdivisions, part is above title.

Parts have distinctive signs of type uppercase Roman numbers I, II, III etc. or numbers written by letters, Part One, Part Two, Part Three etc. which can also be referenced as first part, second part, third part etc.

source.description: subdivision of a legal document used to introduce a group of articles in the enacting terms
This element indicates an agreement as part of an act.

comment.lg.version: Comprising for example the legal definitions.

source.description: operative part of a legal document which follows the preamble
This element indicates the final part of a legal act which follows the enacting terms. The final part contains the place, date and signatures and sometimes also the rule of application.
This element indicates a final act, a specific part of a document, in general in international agreements.
list of headings and subjects of a document, presented in the order in which they appear
This element indicates a common declaration, a specific part of a document, in general in international agreements.
This element indicates a protocol, a specific part of a legal document.
This element indicates a letter integrated into a document, in general in international agreements.
This element indicates information structured by means of a list in a legal document.
vertical arrangement of data in a table
This element indicates a table in a legal document containing text structured in rows and columns with the related data.
horizontal arrangement of data in a table
image supplemented by related text
reference included in a legal document which is specified at the bottom of the same page

comment.lg.version: Indicates in long and highly structured texts the grouping of higher subdivisions (JPG 15.4, p. 28).
Titles have distinctive signs of type uppercase Roman numbers I, II, III etc.

source.description: higher subdivision of an act positioned between part and chapter used to introduce a group of articles in the enacting terms
This element indicates a subclause in the regular structure of a legal document below the level of a section. Example: Council Regulation (EC) No 491/2009 of 25 May 2009.
A sentence is a linguistic unit of grammatically linked words. This subdivision can be cited.
reference included in a legal document which is specified in the end of a subdivision of an act
specific additional explanatory part of a legal document
structure component of a legal article that has a distinctive sign of the type lowercase letters: (a), (b), (c) etc.
structure component of a legal article that has a distinctive sign of the type lowercase Roman numbers: (i), (ii), (iii) etc.

This element indicates a subdivision of the basic act of a consolidation, specified by page number as given in the original publication in the Official Journal (OJ). The figure added to the subdivision indicates the page number in the original publication of the basic act in the OJ.Example: PG:40 indicates a position on page 40 in the original publication of the basic act in the OJ.
This element indicates any non specified subdivision.
This element is specific to the corrigendum type of document. It is used to mark up two or more corrections that have a common introductory sentence.
This element is specific to the corrigendum type of document. It is used to mark up the details about the correction/modification asked for a legal document after its publication.

This element is specific to the corrigendum type of document. It is a subdivision of the correction and is used to mark up the details (subject, location) where the modification should be implemented in a legal document.

This element is specific to the corrigendum type of document. It is a subdivision of the correction and is used to mark up the original text that was published in a document and should be modified by the corrigendum.
This element is specific to the corrigendum type of document. It is a subdivision of the correction and is used to mark up the new text that should replace the old one in a legal document.
This element is used to group tables together that share a common title or a common note.
This element indicates a convention, a specific part of a document, e.g. in a treaty.
This element indicates an exchange of letters, a specific part of a document, e.g. in a treaty.
This element indicates a procedure, a specific part of a document, e.g. in a treaty.
This element indicates minutes, a specific part of a document, e.g. in a treaty.
This element indicates a differentiated legal act, e.g. in the context of an accession treaty.
one or more sentences or phrases in the beginning of a paragraph, or of a subparagraph, or of a point, preceding an enumeration (of points or indents) and ending with a colon ‘:’
part that follows the enumeration in a sentence that includes an enumeration of points or indents
graphical element depicting an object which may contain alphanumeric data

comment.lg.version: If an article is not subdivided, i.e. has only one paragraph, it is an unnumbered paragraph.

source.description: unnumbered subdivision of an article or, exceptionally an element of an annex
first level of an unnumbered subdivision of a numbered paragraph, point or indent, where there are at least two of such elements of subdivision
complex technical or scientific expression
text detailing the meaning of the elements of an image, a table or a scientific formula it relates to
In a legend, a line of legend is a description of an individual element.
subdivision of a bigger text, presented in the form of a list of interventions
